pullRequest.body:
We split `Data.Nat.Cast.Order` into `Data.Nat.Cast.Order.Basic` which only uses unbundled ordered algebra classes and `Data.Nat.Cast.Order.Ring` which uses bundled ordered algebra classes. This avoids importing bundled ordered algebra until later downstream.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

### PR summary [2e4409af3d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14371/commits/2e4409af3d43fe5ff4ed2f6375d30c416ba23a5d)

#### Import changes

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.SetTheory.Cardinal.Basic | 580 | 577 | -3 (-0.52%) |

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ one_le`
`- _root_.NeZero.one_le`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
```

:v: mattrobball can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9770702496/job/26972306901)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9770702496/job/26972306797)

```suggestion
theorem one_le {n : ℕ} [NeZero n] : 1 ≤ n := one_le_iff_ne_zero.mpr (NeZero.ne n)
```

```suggestion
theorem _root_.NeZero.one_le {n : ℕ} [NeZero n] : 1 ≤ n := by have := NeZero.ne n; omega
```
allows you to avoid introducing the import here.

```suggestion
import Mathlib.Data.Nat.Cast.Defs
import Mathlib.Algebra.NeZero

/-!
# Lemmas about nonzero elements of an `AddMonoidWithOne`
-/

open Nat

namespace NeZero

theorem one_le {n : ℕ} [NeZero n] : 1 ≤ n := by have := NeZero.ne n; omega
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore (Data.Nat.Cast.Order): split into `Basic` and `Ring`
